rev.comment: /* Play together by Macca and Lennon */
/* Even Rolling Stone journalists can be accused of POV and going too far. This is an encyclopedia.*/
/* Took out not cited. Lennon's death should not be infused with insinuations about whether they got on together. */
/* 2001-2: Death of George Harrison, and the Concert for George */
/* 2001-2: Death of George Harrison, and the Concert for George */ we don't need to name drop about [[Courtney Love]]; slight reword; is the place of George's death really necessary here?
/* Let's not be frivolous about headers */
/* No need to put in he plays everything twice in the article*/
/* Notes and references */ This is a Section Concerning Notes - The Material Which Is Referenced More than Once Should Go Into the Refs Section
/* External links */ Added Barry Miles Book

Caption should be concise and targetted at the subject matter.

attempt at restructuring per Talk; please bear with me for a few minutes whilst I tidy up the new section and introduce subsections
use birth date and age template
/* Songwriting and musicianship */ Seeing Whitman played left handed was of no help on it's own, it was the way the guitar had been strung that was important.
/* I took out uncited and POV material. */
/* Awards */ Lennon sending his MBE back is irrelevant here; minor copyedit
try another name & position for this troublesome section
/* Post-Beatles */ ==Lennon & McCartney, post-Beatles== still clumsy and unlikely to be the final solution, but post Beatles is too vague
/* Activism */ [[Concerts for the People of Kampuchea]]
/* Macca couldn't have a relationship with John after his death :) */
move some landmines text from Mills section to Activism section
/* 1980s */ Ebert review of [[Give My Regards to Broad Street]]
/* 2000s */ if he appears for a nano-second we don't need to know! cruft.
/* 2000s */ trim - we get half a page on a concert in 2001, and nothing at all on 1963! ;)
/* 1980s */ Last #1 albums (Tug of War in the US, Flowers of the Dirt in the UK, according to [[Paul McCartney discography]])
/* Poetry and writing */ Added {{fact}} Tag - All Exact Numbers Need Verification
/* Post-Beatles relationship with John Lennon and Yoko Ono */ minor copyedit, will do more later
/* Songwriting and musicianship */ intro: Paul McCartney is a [[singer]], [[songwriter]] and [[multi-instrumentalist]] who plays [[bass guitar]], [[piano]], [[guitar]] and [[drums]]; reword
/* Songwriting and musicianship */ rm some excessive links
/* Art, writing and classical music */ fmt

/* Friends and family */ how about removing the piece on George? This is an article on Paul, and it's an uncited opinion piece. Instead, we can mention George's passing & the tributein the chronology?
/* Liverpool Institute for Performing Arts */ copyedit
/* Early years */ [[National Trust for Places of Historic Interest or Natural Beauty|The National Trust]]
bring in first 2 paras of new lead from talk page

/* Relationship with Jane Asher moved cynthia*/

/* 1980s */ Emphasis on Synth? Are We Critics? Nope. We Need Cites from Music Critics.
/* 1970s */ "Maybe I'm Amazed" Acclaimed? By What Noteworthy Critics? Also, When Did Macca Insist him and Linda stay together 24/7? Cites Please!
/* Liverpool Institute for Performing Arts */ Added {{fact}} Tag - His Dream? Since When? The word "Dream" sounds real fancrufty to me
/* 1980s */ Added {{fact}} Tag - Didn't Do Well Commercially? (Film Chart Positions + Quotes Off Film Critics Please - Try that [[Roger Ebert]] guy for a quote)
/* Relationship with Jane Asher */ ref fmt
